title: Associate Solutions Architect
description:
Ready to be a Titan?

The Contractor Advisory Service team is looking for an Associate Solutions Architect to join this highly specialized group in providing proactive consulting services and escalation resolution to our clients as well as supporting the company’s most impactful initiatives.

As an Associate Solutions Architect, you will accompany our customers at various points in their ServiceTitan journey, in tandem with collaboration across our business including teams such as: Product, Professional Services, and Customer Success, to deliver extraordinary outcomes. You will deliver exceptional customer service and communication, have the ability to solve complex client cases with minimal supervision, and meet resolution with a sense of urgency.

What You’ll Do:


High touch 1:1 feature implementations for customers in onboarding and in success.Monthly instructor-lead group feature implementations. Work closely with a mix of, but not limited to, low-to-medium complexity clients and projects to resolve issues which may include conducting account audits, optimization, product adoption implementation, and operational consultingWork closely with and support Solution Architects and Senior Solutions Architects as they lead larger, more complex projects.Conduct root cause analysis on significant or recurring product challenges which will yield innovative solutions, streamlined processes, training materials, and/or industry white papersPartner with cross-functional teams to resolve and/or drive change on any issues that arise while maintaining the highest level of customer satisfactionAssist in the customer journey by advising on sales product market fit, scaling onboarding plans for core product adoption and advanced feature sets, and driving customer engagement, ROI and best practice adoption with the Customer Success team

What You’ll Need:


Bachelor's degree with minimum 2 years of relevant working and/or equivalent experience in the tradesDeep level of product knowledge across the entire platform including at least 2+ years direct experience working with the ServiceTitan productProficient in ServiceTitan’s customer’s inventory processes and the inventory module of ServiceTitan.In-depth understanding of ServiceTitan’s customers’ business and operational needs and prioritiesExperience in leading virtual group training workshops or software implementations.Advanced Excel skills (xlookups, pivot tables, macros, etc)Additional experience of Asana, SQL, Salesforce, QuickBooks (Online and/or Desktop), Intacct, and GSuite is a plusServiceTitan Certified Administrator (STCA) certification recommendedAbility to travel domestically up to 25-50% of the yearExceptional written and verbal communicationStrong project management skills recommendedAbility to take ownership and act as a high performing individual contributor 

Join us and be part of a dynamic, forward-thinking team as we continue to grow and revolutionize the home and commercial services industry.

Be Human With Us:

Being human isn’t about checking every box on a list. It’s about the experiences we have, people we meet, and the perspectives we share. So, if you have the skills but are hesitant to apply because of your background, apply anyway. We need amazing people like you to help us challenge the conventional and think differently about the problems that we’re solving. We’re in this together. Come be human, with us.

What We Offer:

When you join our team, you’re not just accepting a job. You’re making a career move. Here’s how we’ll support you in doing some of the most impactful work of your career:


Flextime, recognition, and support for autonomous work: Flexible time off with ample learning and development opportunities to continue growing your career. We offer a comprehensive onboarding program, leadership training for Titans at all levels, and other programs and events. Great work is rewarded through Bonusly, peer-nominated awards, and more. Holistic health and wellness benefits: Company-paid medical, dental, and vision (with 100% employer paid options and 90% coverage for dependents), FSA and HSA, 401k match, and telehealth options including memberships to Headspace, Galileo, One Medical, Ginger and more. Support for Titans at all stages of life: Parental leave and support, up to $20k in adoption reimbursement, on demand maternity support through Maven Maternity, free breast milk shipping through Maven Milk, pet insurance, legal advisory services, financial planning tools, and more.

At ServiceTitan, we celebrate individuality and uniqueness. We believe that the convergence of fresh perspectives and experiences from all walks of life is what makes our product and culture so great. We strongly encourage people from underrepresented groups to apply. We do not discriminate against employees based on race, color, religion, sex, national origin, gender identity or expression, age, disability, pregnancy (including childbirth, breastfeeding, or related medical condition), genetic information, protected military or veteran status, sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state or local laws.

ServiceTitan is committed to fair and equitable compensation for all of our employees. We thoughtfully consider a wide range of factors when determining individual compensation. The expected salary range for this role for candidates residing in the United States is between $66,000 USD - $94,000 USD. Compensation for candidates residing outside the United States will vary by location and the specific salary range will be discussed during the hiring process. Actual compensation for an individual may vary depending on skills, performance over time, qualifications, experience, and location. In addition to the base salary, the total compensation package also includes an annual bonus, equity and a holistic suite of benefits.

title: Process Technician 2
description:
Job Description/Tasks/Responsibilities

Loads and packs materials into containers for transportation, functions as a control room operator as required, operates a forklift and other heavy equipment as required and reviews documentation of radioactive materials for completion and accuracy. Operates specialized sorting, segregation, size reduction, treatment, and repackaging operations in strict accordance with procedures. May specialize in one area but will attain knowledge and skills in other areas of operations. Follows all safety rules, regulations and procedures. Maintains a clean and orderly work area. Receives oral and/or written instructions from supervisors. Reads and interprets equipment, operations and procedures manuals, as well as waste processing specifications, to be accountable for activities within assigned areas. Operates machinery as required. Wears personal protective equipment (PPE) up to level A when working in contaminated zones following the company’s health physics regulations. Maintains all logs, manifests, records and reports associated with all operations areas to issue and/or maintain the identity of all materials using bar codes. Receives, unloads, identifies, weighs and processes materials through sorting, shredding, overpacking, sea/land operation, resin, compaction, decontamination, special waste operation, metal melting, incineration, tracking systems operation and demolition support activities. Prepares, seals and inspects containers for containment, reliability and redirect as required ensuring quality and reliability of product integrity. Conducts daily, weekly, and monthly facility inspection rounds to ensure safety systems are within tolerances. Drives tractor-trailers or other rigs to transport radioactive and non-radioactive materials within a local area. Prepares bill of lading for transportation of materials in accordance with Department of Transportation requirements. Reviews, problem solves, performs data entry and quality checks on documentation of radioactive waste materials and outgoing radioactive shipments to ensure data is accurately tracked from receipt, through all operation processes and to final disposition. Generates and reviews radioactive material shipment data to assure compliance with policies, procedures, licenses, contracts and appropriate regulations. Demonstrates familiarization with multiple processes such as special waste, material processes, decontamination, incineration, metal melt, compaction, warehouse/yard and tracking systems. title: Millwright 1
description:

title: Scheduler
description:
Job Description/Tasks/Responsibilities

Performs schedule planning and development, maintenance and monitoring activities. Ensures work is completed as scheduled. Provides project controls support related to the integration, control and management of projects; specifically project planning and scheduling, progress management and risk management. Responsible for the collection, input and reporting of schedule data, the assembly and processing of work authorization documentation, and the assembly of documents related to the change control process. Supports the project team with all aspects of the project planning and scheduling functions, including determining durations for the time phasing of the project baseline into the project schedule, management of an integrated schedule, development and updating of progress curves, performance curves and assessment of resources. Controls ongoing project planning and scheduling status and forecasts and reports it to asset management so they are informed of progress. Conducts productivity analysis to identify adverse trends and works with asset management to determine necessary mitigations, using EnergySolutions standard risk software and input from project managers. Coordinates vendor/ subcontractor schedules with the master project schedule so there are no scheduling conflicts. Assists and supports management in ensuring proper control, tracking and alignment with the approved project Work Breakdown/Project Coding structure. Responsible for the development and maintenance of the Work Instructions for scheduling. Assists and supports management in the development of the Work Breakdown Structure (WBS). Reviews or assists in reviewing proposal requirements related to scheduling and material control and develops supporting data for proposal development and contract negotiations. Reviews and assists in reviewing proposal requirements related to determining total scope. Provides support and guidance in the development of Basis of Estimates as related to the scope as defined in the WBS Dictionaries. Controls and implements any and all scope changes to the Performance Measurement Baseline dictated by any and all Baseline Change Proposals. Interfaces with designated management and project proposal team counterparts for specific planning and schedule tasks presentations. Implements and adheres to policies, plans, processes, interfaces and reporting to organize and schedule project work, taking into account time and resource constraints. Promotes a team atmosphere among workers and staff to ensure everyone is working together. Maintains the EPS Database, archiving, access control of the database, schedule heath checks, coding structure, vertical and horizontal traceability in schedules developed, critical path, and monthly Corporate Reporting, Works under general supervision. Ensures work instructions and procedures are followed, schedule health checks are performed and items are corrected for good schedule health. Ensures that the data matches between systems, for the overall health and performance of assigned schedules, maintenance of the baseline and current schedules. Also ensures data matches between systems for what if schedule scenarios, work arounds, critical path analysis, resource leveling and subcontractors schedules. Leads and directs the work of others. Performs other duties as assigned. 


Job Requirements/Skills

Strong organizational and interpersonal skills Strong written and verbal communication skills Advanced knowledge of MS Excel, MS Word, MS PowerPoint Advanced knowledge of Primavera P6, Success Estimator, Cobra, Oracle and EVMS Ability to develop estimates from all sources including Orthograpic Drawings, Isometric Drawings, Valve and Line Lists and Major Equipment Lists and Sketches as required Ability to develop labor unit rates based on the type of project as required Advanced proficiency in the use of R.S. Means and Richardsons as required 


Physical/Mental Requirements And Working Conditions

Ability to sit Ability to effectively communicate; speaking, reading, understanding, writing and hearing clear English; pass audiogram in hearing conservation program as required by location Basic math and computer skills Ability to work inside an office Ability to perform highly repetitive motions with fingers, hands, wrists, and shoulders Ability to work alone, work with others, and interact with the public Ability to perform under deadline pressure Ability to understand and follow basic instructions and guidelines

Education

Bachelor's degree required or equivalent experience in Business or an equivalent technical degree 


Certifications

EVMS or Primavera P6 required; Cobra preferred American Society of Professional Estimators (ASPE) and/or Association for the Advancement of Cost Engineering (AACE) certification preferred 


Required Experience

A minimum of 10 years of experience in the field or related experience required 


Preferred Experience

Previous experience with the decommissioning of nuclear power plants preferred

title: QA Engineer
description:

Supports management and staff with QA services, as requested. Ensures Project staff understand quality requirements and how these requirements apply to their work. Develops and provides training on QA-related topics and assists in the resolution of quality-related problems.

Strong interpersonal skills and a team player attitude. Working knowledge of Microsoft Office products. Working knowledge of NRC regulations and industry guidance. Working knowledge of assessment/auditing practices. Working knowledge of causal analysis techniques. Working knowledge of radioactive and/or hazardous material management.

Bachelor's or Associate’s degree in a technical field (radiological sciences or nuclear technology preferred); or 10 years of equivalent technical experience* 


Certifications

Previously Qualified NQA-1 Lead Auditor (desired) Active 10CFR50 Licensee Certification as a lead auditor per NQA-1 (desired) 


Required Experience

5 years of Operating/Decommissioning Nuclear Plant experience with 2 years in the Quality Assurance disciplines (with degree), Operating experience should include oversight or direct participation, but not limited to Emergency Preparedness, Chemistry, Radiation Protection, Physical Security OR 15 years of total experience, with 5 years of Operating/Decommissioning Nuclear Plant experience with a minimum of 2 years in the Quality Assurance disciplines (without degree*) 


Preferred Experience

A minimum of 2 years of planning and conducting QA audits/assessments. A minimum of 2 years of experience in program management and/or Quality Engineering. A minimum of 3 years of direct/indirect experience in Radiological Protection, Chemistry, Radwaste or Final Status Survey/Characterization. Experience in application of causal analysis techniques.

Ability to sit, stand, walk, climb, bend/stoop, crouch and kneel. Ability to effectively communicate; pass audiogram in hearing conservation program as required by location. Ability to see close and distance; basic colors/shades. Ability to work inside an office, outside and in extreme temperatures. Ability to work on slippery/uneven walking surfaces. Ability to work alone, work with others, and interact with the public. Ability to operate equipment, drive a vehicle and travel overnight. Ability to perform under deadline pressure.

title: Partnership Executive
description:
About the CompanyFusion Growth Partners is a business incubator and micro venture capital company. We invest in businesses that have a tremendous record of accomplishment, but most investors ignore it. When we partner with small service-based businesses of individual real estate agents, we invest heavily into their businesses to them significantly grow their clientele and scale business profits. We consider ourselves as a “Partnership as a Service” business similar to, but different than, a SaaS business. Fusion was recently ranked as the 813th fastest-growing business by Inc. 5000. Therefore, we consider this role to be one of the best opportunities for sales professional business advisors available today.
Our partners benefit from Fusion providing their business with sophisticated growth planning, a full suite of back-office services and SaaS resources, plus the support of our experienced staff. Fusion is the only company in the country that currently offers these services and is compensated in a way that conveniently accommodates the cash flow challenges of a real estate agent. We have over 300 team members and are growing very quickly. We need more talent to enter untouched markets.
Fusion invests in companies through strategic revenue-sharing growth partnerships. Our investment resources include, but are not limited to, thousands of dollars of business building systems and processes and the staff to operate those business systems which are all provided as an investment into our partners' businesses. Fusion’s income is primarily generated from a small share of the revenue generated by our partner’s businesses. Our company is looking to hire additional Partnership Development Executives to support our rapidly growing volume of new partnership investments.
Job descriptionA Partnership Development Executive functions as the business advisor to influence revenue and transaction volume growth for Fusion’s business investment partnerships. A successful candidate will provide Fusion’s partners with attentive support and business coaching to dramatically expand their business profitability.
The income potential of this commission-based, revenue-sharing, position is typically $70,000 annually starting out. As a Partnership Development Executive’s “book of business” grows, they can realistically earn $250,000 annually or more, within the first two years. We are only looking for amazing talented individuals who can help us grow and represent Fusion at the highest levels of professionalism.
The two main responsibilities of this position are (1) business development of investment acquisitions and (2) managing partnership relationships as Fusion’s business advisor.
The purpose of our Partnership Development Executive is to “build” a book of business of high-quality partners and then to be fanatically obsessed with the success and business growth of each one of the partners you serve. The Partnership Development Executive, as an executive, is responsible for the partner's experience and business success in partnership with Fusion. Fusion provides a team of individuals to work on the client’s behalf, but the PDE must push for success. Real estate agents and other small businesses join us for the purpose of scaling their businesses and it is the job of PDE to make sure that happens.
A Partnership Development Executive’s Two Main Functions Investment / Partner Acquisition: The Partnership Development Executive’s purpose is to qualify potential business candidates, and provide a detailed explanation of investment to potential partners. If the partner candidate has a high desire to engage in partnership with Fusion, then the Partner Development Executive helps structure the “deal.” It is a little bit like Shark Tank, but quite different as well. It is our practice to present our services personally to a potential partner to ensure full comprehension and interaction with that partner.Business Advisor: When we invest in one of these small businesses, part of your job is to function like a “board member” or trusted advisor to the business owner to encourage best practices and to fully adoption of our systems to ensure the likelihood of their success.
Successful candidates for this position will be trained extensively on our go-to-market strategy, business philosophies, and systems/processes. We provide a very specific process and system unique in the business world.For the benefit of those who are reading this ad, you can view an example of the presentation we provide for Real Estate Agents at:https://www.succeedwithfusion.com/fusion-partnership-in-detail-videosand you can view the rest of our website at: https://www.fusiongrowthpartners.net
Our Ideal CandidateOur ideal candidate is a polished professional with highly effective communication skills, who is very persuasive but not “salesy,” does not shy away from difficult conversations, and attacks problems or issues head-on. A successful candidate must be able to present ideas and concepts with confidence and assurance. That candidate must be able to work with very strong-willed people and be able to show them Fusion’s unique perspective, which they will embrace over time. Experience in the residential real estate industry is helpful but not necessary or required.
Position RequirementsPossess a "fanatical obsession" with the success of every single client you manage.Possess a "fanatical obsession" with doing the best you can for everyone on your team.Possess a "fanatical obsession" with contributing to the success of the companyHighly Professional in appearance, dress, and action.Willing to follow company systems and processes.Able to work autonomously with little or no supervision.Very comfortable and confident in presenting concepts and ideas.A true servant leader.Authentic and genuine personality.A great communicator.
Please provide a resume if you are interested in learning more about this opportunity.

title: Sales Director

The ideal candidate for this position comes from either an Insurance background or a SaaS Fintech background, having proven experience hunting new business, driving sales, and increasing customer base. title: Commercial Lending Business Analyst
description:
Infosys is seeking a Commercial Lending Business Analyst. title: Welder, 1st Shift

Responsibilities:

Heat and form metal parts and components using hand tools, torch, plasma cutter/ carbon arc or other welding equipment; properly position material/parts to be welded. capable of welding all materials at the location. Operate an overhead crane to maneuver parts safely into place; adjust welding current to proper weld configurations Accurately operate and read measuring devices. Maintain a safe and clean work environment in compliance with safety procedures, rules, and proper 6S standards; use practices to follow all safe procedures in assembling and testing of all models/products in assigned job function. Train and work in various areas of production in response to production demands


Minimum Qualifications are:

Passed weld test either through pre-employment test or through internal weld programAbility to start and run a welderAbility effectively preforms job tasks within one station with little to no quality defects or guidanceWillingness to learn to change your own wire


Preferred qualifications include:

High School Diploma or GED6 months of applicable position experienceUnderstanding of quality defects within weld on products. Ability to read and use measuring devices.
